title: Voices of the mad: patients' letters from the Royal Edinburgh Asylum, 1873â€“1908
abstract: The evidence in the patients' letters argues for the unchanging nature of mental illness across time, at least for the last 120 years. It also demonstrates that patients admitted to the Royal Edinburgh Asylum suffered from serious mental illness, and it undermines the view that the Asylum was simply a dumping ground for society's disaffected.
